# Work with delegate types in C#

> Documentation for Work with delegate types in C#.

- [Delegates with Named vs. Anonymous Methods](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/programming-guide/delegates/delegates-with-named-vs-anonymous-methods.md): Learn about delegates with named vs. anonymous methods. See code examples and view other available resources.
- [How to combine delegates (Multicast Delegates)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/programming-guide/delegates/how-to-combine-delegates-multicast-delegates.md): Learn how to combine delegates to create multicast delegates. See a code example and view more available resources.
- [How to declare, instantiate, and use a delegate](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/programming-guide/delegates/how-to-declare-instantiate-and-use-a-delegate.md): Learn how to declare, instantiate, and use a delegate. This article provides several examples of declaring, instantiating, and invoking delegates.
- [Work with delegate types in C#](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/programming-guide/delegates/index.md): Explore delegate types in C#. A delegate is a date type that refers to a method with a defined parameter list and return type. You use delegates to pass methods as arguments to other methods.
- [Using Delegates](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/programming-guide/delegates/using-delegates.md): Learn how to use delegates. Delegates are an object-oriented, type safe, and secure type that safely encapsulates a method.
